N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.6 - Executive order no. 6: amending executive order of may 23, 1967 (no. 23) relating to the health planning commission

State Regulations
I, Hugh L. Carey, Governor of the State of New York, by
virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and the Laws of the

State of New York, do hereby direct by Executive Order that Executive Order

Number 23, promulgated by Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller on May 23, 1967, which
established the Health Planning Commission, as amended by his Executive Orders
of April 16, 1968, October 8, 1969, October 8, 1970 and April 2, 1971 and as
further amended by Executive Order Number 2, promulgated by Governor Malcolm

Wilson on January 30, 1974, be amended to read as follows: By virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution
and Laws of the State of New York, I, Hugh L. Carey, Governor of the State of

New York, do hereby establish within the Executive Department and
interdepartmental health planning commission, to be known as the Health

Planning Commission, to consist of the Commissioners of Health, Mental Hygiene, and Social Services, the Directors of the Budget and of the Office of Planning

Services and the Special Assistant to the Governor on Health Affairs, the
chairman to be the Special Assistant to the Governor on Health Affairs. I. General Powers

The Commission shall advise the Governor on all
health-related matters and shall act to implement his concerns in shaping
health policy for the State. The Commission shall review all the plans of State agencies
relating to the provision of health and mental health services to assure that
such plans are in accordance with State health policies. The Commission shall coordinate and review health planning
efforts among governmental and nongovernmental agencies, organizations and
groups concerned with health services, facilities and manpower. The Commission is hereby directed to supervise the
implementation of the Federal National Health Planning and Resources

Development Act of 1974, and all program planning necessary to comply with the
terms of that act and any other acts relating to State comprehensive health
planning, and to do all things necessary or convenient to fulfill the purposes
and requirements of such act or acts. The Commission shall have the power to convene
interdepartmental committees composed of the heads of appropriate agencies and
the members of the Commission, whenever it shall appear to the chairman that
the matters within the jurisdiction of another agency will affect the health
policies of the State. In exercising its powers, functions and duties, the

Commission shall be responsible to the Governor and shall consult and work
closely with the Health Planning Advisory Council and any other councils or
commissions hereafter established for the purpose of comprehensive health
planning in the State. II. Health Planning Advisory Council

In order to provide the State with the broadest policy
advice in matters of health and mental health, a Health Planning Advisory

Council is hereby established to consist of representatives of governmental and
nongovernmental organizations and groups concerned with health, providers and
consumers of health services, to advise the Health Planning Commission in the
exercise of its powers, functions and duties under this Order and the Federal

National Health Planning and Resources Act of 1974 and any other act relating
to State comprehensive health planning. The members of the Advisory Council
shall be appointed by the Governor. III. Department of Health

The Commissioner of Health shall establish a unit within
the Department of Health to provide all personal and other services as may be
necessary or desirable to assist the Health Planning Commission to fulfill the
purposes of this Order. The Department of Health, acting for and on behalf of the

Health Planning Commission, is hereby authorized to receive and disburse funds
from the Federal Government granted for comprehensive planning purposes. The Department of Health, acting for and on behalf of the

Health Planning Commission, shall enter into such contracts and agreements as
shall be necessary or convenient to fulfill the purposes of this Order. IV. Effective Date

Executive Order Number 23, dated May 23, 1967, and

Executive Orders Number 25, dated April 16, 1968, Number 34, dated October 8, 1970, Number 47, dated April 2, 1971 and Number 2, dated January 30, 1974, which amended such Executive Order, are hereby amended and superseded by this

Executive Order effective March 14, 1975. Signed: Hugh L. CareyDated: March 14, 1975
I, Hugh L. Carey, Governor of the State of New York, by
virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and the Laws of the

State of New York, do hereby direct by Executive Order that the second
paragraph of Executive Order Number 6, promulgated on March 14, 1975, which
established the Health Planning Commission, be amended to read as
follows: By virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution
and Laws of the State of New York, I, Hugh L. Carey, Governor of the State of

New York, do hereby establish within the Executive Department an
interdepartmental health planning commission, to be known as the Health

Planning Commission, to consist of the Commissioners of Health, Mental Hygiene, Social Services, and Education, the Director of the Office for the Aging, the

Director of the Budget, the Chancellor of the State University of New York, and
the Special Assistant to the Governor for Health Affairs, who shall serve as
chairman. Signed: Hugh L. CareyDated: February 4, 1976
I, Hugh L. Carey, Governor of the State of New York, by
virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws of the State
of New York, do hereby establish within the Executive Department an
interdepartmental health planning commission, to be known as the Health

Planning Commission, to consist of the Commissioners of Health, Mental Health, Mental Retardation and Developmental Disabilities, Social Services, Education, and Environmental Conservation; the Directors of the Office for the Aging, the

Division of Alcoholism and Alcohol Abuse, the Division of Substance Abuse

Services, the Office of Health Systems Management and the Office of Public

Health; the Chairman of the Commission on Alcohol and Substance Abuse

Prevention and Education, the Chairman of the Commission on Quality of Care for
the Mentally Disabled, the Director of the Budget, the Chancellor of the State

University of New York, the Executive Director of the Board of Social Welfare, the Special Assistant to the Governor for Health Affairs, who shall serve as
chairman, and his designated deputy, who shall serve as
vice-chairman.[FN*]
I. General Powers

The Commission shall advise the Governor on all health, mental health, mental retardation and developmental disabilities, alcoholism, alcohol abuse and substance abuse, environmental health, and domiciliary
care-related matters and shall act to implement his concerns in shaping State
policy in these matters. The Commission shall review all the plans of State agencies
relating to the provision of health, mental health, mental retardation and
developmental disabilities, alcoholism, alcohol abuse and substance abuse, and
domiciliary care services to assure that such plans are in accordance with

State policies. The Commission shall coordinate and review health, mental
health, mental retardation and developmental disabilities, alcoholism, alcohol
abuse and substance abuse, and domiciliary care planning efforts among
governmental and nongovernmental agencies, organizations and groups concerned
with health, mental health, mental retardation and developmental disabilities, alcoholism, alcohol abuse and substance abuse, and domiciliary care services, facilities and manpower. The Commission is hereby designated as the single State
health planning and development agency pursuant to the provisions of the

National Health Planning and Resources Development Act of 1974, as amended, and
is directed to supervise the implementation of the National Health Planning and

Resources Development Act of 1974 and all program planning necessary to comply
with the terms of that act and any other acts relating to State comprehensive
health, mental health, mental retardation and developmental disabilities, alcoholism, alcohol abuse and substance abuse, and domiciliary care planning, and to do all things necessary or convenient to fulfill the purposes and
requirements of such act or acts. The Commission shall have the power to convene
interdepartmental committees composed of the heads of appropriate agencies and
the members of the Commission, whenever it shall appear to the chairman that
the matters within the jurisdiction of another agency will affect the health, mental health, mental retardation and developmental disabilities, alcoholism, alcohol abuse and substance abuse or domiciliary care policies of the

State. II. Certificate of

Need Administrative Program

The Commission is directed to administer the State
certificate of need program, which program meets the requirements of the

National Health Planning and Resources Development Act of 1974 and 42 CFR
123, Subpart E, of the Federal rules promulgated thereunder and any amendments
thereto. The certificate of need reviews performed by the reviewer members of
the Commission shall be in accordance with the State Health Plan of the Health

Planning Commission and with the policies and procedures of the Health Planning

Commission as determined by the Commission. An agreement shall be entered into
between the reviewer members of the Health Planning Commission and the

Commission which shall implement this Certificate of Need Administrative

Program. III. Commission

Committees

The Commission is authorized to appoint committees of its
members for the purposes of performing Commission functions. Any member of the

Commission may attend any or all committee meetings and, if such member so
elects, shall become a fully participating committee member at any such
meeting. Any committee appointed pursuant to this paragraph for the purpose of
making recommendations on the establishment or construction of any services or
facilities may consist of Commission members together with their designated
representatives. IV. Personnel

The Commission shall appoint an Executive Director and
shall assign to such Executive Director such powers, functions and duties as it
shall deem appropriate. The Commission may employ such additional personnel as
it may deem necessary or desirable to fulfill the purposes of this Order and of
the National Health Planning and Resources Development Act of 1974. V. Office of Health Systems

Management in the Department of Health
A unit shall be established within the Department of

Health's Office of Health Systems Management to provide such services as may be
necessary or desirable to assist the Executive Director to fulfill the purpose
of this Order. The Department of Health's Office of Health Systems

Management, acting for and on behalf of the Health Planning Commission, is
hereby authorized to receive and disburse funds from the Federal government
granted for comprehensive planning purposes. The Department of Health's Office of Health Systems

Management, acting for and on behalf of the Health Planning Commission, shall
enter into such contracts and agreements as shall be necessary or convenient to
fulfill the purposes of this Order. VI. Effective Date

Executive Order Number 1, dated March 31, 1960; Executive

Order Number 23, dated May 23, 1967; Executive Order Number 25, dated April 16, 1968; Executive Order Number 34, dated October 8, 1969; Executive Order Number
40, dated October 8, 1970; Executive Order Number 47, dated April 2, 1971; Executive Order Number 2, dated January 9, 1974; Executive Order Number 6, dated March 14, 1975; and Executive Order Number 6.1, dated February 4, 1976, are superseded by this Executive Order Number 6.2, effective March 14, 1979. Signed: Hugh L. CareyDated: March 14, 1979
I, Hugh L. Carey, Governor of the State of New York, by
virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and the Laws of the

State of New York, do hereby direct by Executive Order that the first paragraph
of Executive Order No. 6.2, promulgated on March 14, 1979, which established
the Health Planning Commission, be amended to read as follows: I, Hugh L. Carey, Governor of the State of New York, by
virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws of the State
of New York, do hereby establish within the Executive Department an
interdepartmental health planning commission, to be known as the Health

Planning Commission, to consist of the Commissioners of Health, Mental Health, Mental Retardation and Developmental Disabilities, Social Services and

Education; the Directors of the Office for the Aging, the Office of Public

Health, the Office of Health Systems Management, the Division of Alcoholism and

Alcohol Abuse, the Division of Substance Abuse Services and the Council on

Children and Families; the Chairman of the Commission on Quality of Care for
the Mentally Disabled; the Director of the Budget; the Chancellor of the State

University of New York; the Advocate for the Disabled; and the Secretary to the

Governor, who shall serve as chairman, and his designated deputy who shall
serve as vice-chairman. Signed: Hugh L. CareyDated: September 23, 1982
